drug.name: Peginterferon alfacon-1
drug.description: PEGylation is a technology for the chemical attachment of polyethylene glycol (PEG) polymer chains to a broad range of drug substances such as peptides and proteins including antibody fragments; small molecules, and other drugs. [Infergen] is a bio-engineered type I interferon alpha that is FDA-approved for the treatment of patients with chronic hepatitis C infections.

article.citation: Witthoeft T, Fuchs M, Ludwig D: Recent i.v.-drug users with chronic hepatitis C can be efficiently treated with daily high dose induction therapy using consensus interferon: an open-label pilot study. World J Gastroenterol. 2007 Jan 28;13(4):579-84.
Higuchi Y, Hashida M: [Pharmaceutical device of IFN]. Nihon Rinsho. 2006 Jul;64(7):1374-9.

Wang F, Liu Y, Li J, Ma G, Su Z: On-column refolding of consensus interferon at high concentration with guanidine-hydrochloride and polyethylene glycol gradients. J Chromatogr A. 2006 May 19;1115(1-2):72-80. Epub 2006 Mar 20.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in hepatitis (viral, C).
drug.mechanism-of-action: The effect of PEGylation is to increase drug circulation time in the bloodstream, improve drug solubility and stability, and reduce immunogenicity. The potential advantages of PEGylation are to decrease dosing frequency, improve drug efficacy and safety, improve stability, and simplify drug formulation.

drug-interaction.name: Peginterferon alfa-2a
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Peginterferon alfacon-1 can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfa-2a.
